documents.title: our top stories from today
text: that 's all from us for today , we 'll be back tomorrow from 06:30 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for yorkshire .
updates on breaking news will continue throughout the night , but before we go , let 's look back at some of our top stories from today :
see you tomorrow .

documents.title: bradford 's bevan house gps treat homeless people in motorhome
text: a healthcare practice is treating hard-to-reach people using an old motorhome as a surgery .
bevan healthcare , in bradford city centre , was formed about 14 years ago to help patients who do not often have access to a gp .
the van is used to take care on the road to treat drug addicts , sex workers , refugees and homeless patients .

documents.title: prisoners ' jail time extended after attack on fellow inmate
text: two prisoners at lindholme prison have had their jail time extended after attacking another inmate and leaving him with a broken jaw .

adam woodhouse , 23 , formerly of harehills , leeds and marlon james , 24 , formerly of chapeltown , leeds , appeared before sheffield crown court on monday 4 september , where they entered guilty pleas .
the attack happened in may last year .

woodhouse , who is currently serving a six year sentence for burglary and vehicle theft and was due to be released next year , pleaded guilty to wounding and was sentenced to a further 27 months in prison.james , serving an eight year sentence for possession of a firearm , pleaded guilty to assault occasioning actual bodily harm and was jailed for a further 24 weeks in prison .

documents.title: sheffield hallam on university challenge tonight
text: does paxman ever play nice ?
good luck fellas , show them how it 's done !
will paxo play nice ?
do we have a hallam monkman ?
tune in to bbc2 at 8pm tonight to find out ( and watch # teamhallam take on newcastle ) !
imagine .
question one : `` what 's a tensor ? ''
this !
and when he used to throw and/or drop his pen !
less than impressive !
good luck # teamhallam !
good luck # teamhallam , we 'll be cheering you on

documents.title: more north yorkshire police to get mental health training
text: a trial to give specialist mental health training to over two hundred north yorkshire police officers has been so successful that the force is to train more people .
it means that they can now understand and deal with anyone with a mental health issue .
the trial was run with the university of york who developed the training package .
it was delivered by mental health teams at tees , esk and wear valleys nhs foundation trust .
the force 's deputy chief constable lisa winward says the project has been valuable and the training allows them to help provide a better service to people in distress .
the survey results suggest that there was a positive change in police officers ' knowledge , attitudes and confidence in responding to incidents involving individuals with mental health problems .

documents.title: patients affected by computer failure at yorkshire hospitals
text: a number of operations and appointments at hospitals in wakefield , pontefract and dewsbury have had to be postponed because of major computer problems .
there have also been delays at a & e departments - and some patients due to go home have n't been able to be discharged .
it 's not clear how many of the trust 's hospitals or patients were affected .
the mid yorkshire nhs trust said the issue was caused by a failure in a key piece of it network hardware and that the problem was not a cyber attack .
we are now focussed on addressing the backlog of patients waiting to be seen and i am extremely sorry for the inconvenience caused to many patients and their families . ''

documents.title: watch : a course in morris dancing ?
text: fancy trying your hand at morris dancing ?
a troupe in sheffield is putting on a four-week course to teach people the moves :
author: Jenny Eells
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: travel update : accident at pool bridge
text: if you 're harrogate or leeds bound on the back roads this afternoon , this could seriously slow you down :
rtc scene still closed down at # poolbridge # pool # poolinwharfedale # a658 traffic gridlocked .
please use alternative routes .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: leeds school in lockdown after man seen with imitation weapon
text: a school in leeds was put into lockdown this afternoon after police received reports of a man outside carrying a weapon .
leeds east academy took the precaution just after 14:30 .
a man was arrested for possession of an imitation firearm .

documents.title: amateur foodies to sell products in yorkshire dales shop for tv show
text: celebrity chef tom kerridge is to front a new bbc tv programme which is looking for britain 's best artisan food producer .
the amateurs will promote and sell their products in a real shop in the heart of the yorkshire dales .
they 'll be judged by customers and judges nisha katona , who is a food writer and restaurateur , and artisan expert alison swan parente .
the foodies will be also hoping to convince them that their food deserves to have a permanent space on the shelves .
judges will also decide if the food producers have what it takes to sustain a profitable business .
at the same their products must appeal to the local customers .
the series will end with the shop being filled with seven winning products from the seven different categories and locals will chooose the winner .
it is due to be shown on bbc 2 next year .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: man dies 2 weeks after motorbike crash near sheffield
text: a 39-year-old man has died after his motorbike crashed on rivelin valley road near hillsborough last month .
it happened at around 14:25 on sunday 27 august when the green kawasaki ninja hit a tree .
the man died yesterday , two weeks after the incident .
police are appealing for information .

documents.title: elderly man and dog rescued from barge at gargrave
text: firefighters have rescued an elderly man and his dog after their barge started to take on water at gargrave near skipton .
crews were called out just before midday to the leeds liverpool canal .
they secured the sinking barge and rescued its occupants , before pumping out the water .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: listen : labour mp says leadership advice is wrong
text: there 's a further debate in parliament today on the government 's brexit bill , with ministers saying it is essential to ease the process of leaving the european union .
labour mps have been told by their leadership to vote against it .
don valley mp and former europe minister caroline flint says her party is wrong to oppose the second reading .

documents.title: more power problems in rotherham
text: this morning we told you about a power cut that was affecting around 850 properties in rotherham .
that 's now sorted , however , there are fresh problems affecting 520 properties in the s11 , s60 , s62 , and s70 postcodes .
the power should be back on for around 17:00 today .

documents.title: stabbing in leeds : 25-year-old man left with serious wounds
text: a 25-year-old man is in hospital with serious injuries after a stabbing in leeds city centre this lunchtime .
it happened at 13:22 at the junction of briggate and the headrow .
police say they 're looking for two suspects who are described as young black males .
forensic officers are still at the scene and have cordoned off two areas at the top of the busy shopping street .
we would like to hear from anyone who witnessed the incident or who saw the suspects in the area or leaving the scene . ''
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Yorkshire Live

documents.title: part of greasbrough hall to be demolished
text: rotherham council has approved plans to knock down most of a landmark town hall .
all but the facade of greasbrough hall will be demolished to make way for a scheme to ease traffic congestion .
local campaigners were hoping to take it over but council decided against it .

documents.title: m1 crash causes delays
text: there 's been a multi-vehicle crash on the m1 northbound in west yorkshire at junction 40 .
highways england say it 's blocking three lanes but traffic is slowly passing on the inside lane .

documents.title: watch : latest from leeds city centre stabbing
text: an area of briggate , the main shopping street in leeds has been cordoned off this afternoon after police say a man has been stabbed .
details are still sketchy , here are the latest from the scene :

documents.title: breakingstabbing on street in centre of leeds
text: police say they 're at the scene of a man being stabbed in leeds , it 's happened at the top of briggate .
this is the scene in the last few minutes :
we 'll bring you more as we get it .
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Yorkshire Live

documents.title: what do you think about moving the a59 at kex gill ?
text: you 're being asked for your views on plans to realign the a59 at kex gill .
if you use it regularly you 'll know about how much the land moves and how unstable the land around it is .
remember the landslip last year which closed the road for eight weeks ?
it 's an important trans pennine route between skipton and harrogate .
north yorkshire county council wants to realign the road to the other side of the valley as part of their plans to improve east west connections .
four routes have been chosen as the most feasible and they want your views .
the public consultation ends on 31 october
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: thieves target primary school children 's outdoor unit
text: a primary school outdoor unit has been broken into and equipment stolen .
it happened on sunday at about 04:00 at goldthorpe primary school near barnsley .
equipment including drills , a toolbox , and garden tools were stolen .
the school uses the tools to run their own allotment , with some of the food being used in school dinners .
around 70 school children benefited from the outdoor class .
author: Oli Constable
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: weather warning in place for north yorkshire tomorrow night
text: the met office has issued a weather warning of strong winds affecting north yorkshire .
it 's in place from 20:00 on tuesday night until 10:00 on wednesday morning .
it warns of gusts up to 75 miles an hour in exposed places , and says there 's a chance of power cuts and damage to trees and possibly buildings .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: breakingtravel : train services through huddersfield returning to normal
text: we told you earlier about problems with flooding on the line between huddersfield and stalybridge .
services are beginning to get back to normal .
tpe customer assist
tpeassist

info : following heavy rain flooding the railway , trains through # stalybridge & # huddersfield now running ok

BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: brawl in malton leaves two men injured
text: did you see a fight outside the new globe inn on yorkersgate in malton on saturday night ?
it involved a group of men and left one with injuries to his head while another suffered facial injuries and a punctured lung .
three local men were later arrested on sus of wounding with intent and are in police custody .
if you saw what happened get in touch with north yorkshire police .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: sheffield landmarks in lego form
text: the most complex model i could ever make with lego was a sorry looking `` house '' , that would be wonky and mismatched .
but it seems the team at bricks and bits in hillsborough are far better than me .
take a look at some of the sheffield landmarks they 've made .
the `` cheese grater '' car park and st paul 's tower in the city centre .
they 're on the counter in the shop if you fancy a look - but what landmark should they build next ?
author: Oli Constable
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: leeds actress liz dawn 'quite chipper ' in hospital
text: leeds actress liz dawn is recovering in hospital with a lung condition and is said to be `` quite chipper '' .
the former coronation street star , 78 , played hit character vera duckworth for two decades in the itv soap , was rushed to hospital last week .
her spokesman barry mcmanus said `` liz is recovering in hospital and according to members of the family is quite chipper . ''

her character was written out of the show in january 2008 at the actress 's request , she had been diagnosed as suffering from the lung disease , emphysema , in 2004 and there were further complications in 2007 .

documents.title: sheffield 's matthew fitzpatrick wins european masters
text: matthew fitzpatrick won his fourth european tour title with a dramatic play-off victory over australia 's scott hend at the european masters .
the 23-year-old shot a closing six-under 64 to end on 14 under at crans-sur-sierre golf club in switzerland .
i 'm delighted .
it 's one that i 've always wanted to win .
i love playing this golf course .
it 's always stood out on the schedule . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: bradford to open film office in china
text: bradford is opening a film office in china as part of the developing relationship between the two country 's film industries .
bradford is the world 's first unesco city of film - because of its festivals and heritage .
the office in china will develop co production projects between uk and chinese filmmakers and offer advice on studying film and tv production in the uk .
china will also open an office in bradford , in a move the city 's council describes as `` developing in the areas of science and technology as well as film and tv production . ''

documents.title: rotherham care leavers could be council tax exempt
text: young people leaving care in rotherham might not have to pay council tax , if plans are approved later today .
care leavers under 21 and those up to the age of 25 who are in full time education , would be made exempt from council tax demands .
rotherham council would be one of the first councils in the country to approve the recommendations made by the children 's society , a national charity for vulnerable children .

documents.title: man seriously hurt in whitby - did you see what happened ?
text: north yorkshire police are appealing for witnesses after a 51-year-old man suffered serious head injuries in whitby .
police say an alteraction happened two men at the windmill inn on stainsacre lane on friday night at about 20:00 .
the victim was taken to james cook hospital in middlesbrough with serious head injuries .
a 48- year-old man from whitby has been arrested on sus of wounding with intent and has been released on conditional bail .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: woman sexually assaulted by man on street
text: a woman was sexually assaulted by a man who approached her on a street in west yorkshire .
it happened last month on stile common road , huddersfield , when the woman in her 40s , was approached by a man who asked her to go to the park with him .
she refused and he sexually assaulted her and then walked away .
officers are looking for a white man , aged in his late teens , of slim build , over 5ft 6ins tall , with short , cropped hair which was white at the front and grey at the back .

documents.title: evacuation of shopping centre 'was a drill '
text: earlier we told you that leeds ' trinity shopping centre had been evacuated :
the shopping centre has now confirmed that it was just a fire drill and there is no cause for concern .

documents.title: breakingman arrested on sus of murder over sheffield death
text: a 21-year-old man has been arrested on sus of murder after the death of a 31-year-old man in the firth park area of sheffield over the weekend .
the 31-year-old had suffered stab wounds and was taken to hospital where he died a short time later .
police were called at around midnight on sunday , 10 september to reports of a man who had been seriously injured on the wensley estate in firth park .
police are appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: listen : promise of no rent increase on york allotments
text: there are concerns about the future of hundreds of allotment plots in york because of plans to hand them over to a charitable trust .
the idea is being debated by councillors later .
the trust would be run by a team of expert gardeners , adam myers is one of the would be trustees .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: trains running between doncaster and sheffield
text: we 've been telling you this morning about the problems on the rails because of engineering works over-running .
lines have reopened between doncaster and sheffield now though , with delays on some services to london king 's cross as everything gets back to normal .
trains are now able to run normally between # doncaster and sheffield , following overrunning engineering work between these stations .

documents.title: travel : rail line flooded between stalybridge and huddersfield
text: there are problems on the trains between stalybridge and huddersfield this morning because of flooding due to heavy rain .
transpennine express says services are suspended at the moment
this means that trains between these stations may be cancelled or delayed by up to 20 minutes .
disruption is expected until 12:00 .
services affected are northern between wigan wallgate , preston , blackpool north and huddersfield
transpennine express between manchester piccadilly and hull , between manchester airport and middlesbrough and york and also between liverpool lime street and scarborough and newcastle .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: 'milkbot ' introduced at north yorkshire village
text: how would you feel about buying your milk from a vending machine ?
you 'll have read or heard about the tough times dairy farmers have had over the last few years .
for one farm in elvington just outside of york they 've decided to do something about it .
they 've launched this .
it 's a `` milkbot '' which is a vending machine where villagers can buy their milk direct from the farmers .
greyleys jerseys started in 1876 and now it is run by the fifth generation of the family .
helen stanier from the farm says lots of people had been asking how they could get hold of their milk so they decided to introduce the vending machine in the village .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

text: drivers in west yorkshire are facing rush-hour delays this morning following a crash on the m62 near halifax .

documents.title: speedway : new date set for witches trip to sheffield
text: after bad weather got the better of yesterday 's meeting between sheffield tigers and ipswich witches the two clubs have quickly agreed a date for the rescheduled fixture .
we will now face sheffield on thursday september 14 in the second meeting of a double header # speedway # tru7witches

be careful and safe .
good luck for everybody ; - ]

documents.title: hundreds of homes without power in rotherham
text: homes in rotherham are without power after a problem with cables or equipment .
northern powergrid say they hope to get the power to the 850 buildings back on by 11:00 in the s60 and s61 area .
we know about the # powercut in # s61 .
we 're working hard to get the power back on , thanks for your patience , updates to follow

documents.title: listen : free baby boxes in leeds for new-borns
text: new parents across leeds will receive a free baby box from today to help their newborns sleep safely .
leeds teaching hospital nhs trust is launching yorkshire 's first free baby box programme .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: travel : updates on the roads across yorkshire this morning
text: there 's been a lot of heavy rain overnight and the showers are continuing which is making driving conditions across the region challenging .
one lane is closed and very slow traffic due to broken down vehicle on m62 eastbound at j24 a629 ( ainley top ) .
slow traffic on a629 huddersfield road northbound at a646 dryclough lane / haigh lane in the roadworks .
traffic heavier than normal on a638 york road between a635 barnsley road ( the sun traffic lights ) and a19 bentley road ( st mary 's roundabout ) .
both directions , shipton , north yorkshire .
slow traffic due to accident on east lane in both directions at mucky lane / corban lane .

BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: man due in court charged with murder
text: a man 's due in court charged with the murder of a 73-year-old man
philip slater was found dead at a house in silsden on thursday .
alistair throup aged 47 , oakland street , keighley , is due to appear before magistrates in bradford later .

documents.title: listen : more children being excluded from sheffield schools
text: there 's been a rise in the number of children excluded from schools in sheffield , particularly primary academy schools .
a report from the council says it 's concerned about the number of school days lost due to fixed-term exclusions of anything up to up to five days .
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: travel : a170 at sutton bank closed all week
text: if your journey takes you up or down sutton bank today , then you 'll need to find a different route .
that 's because the a170 between helmsley and thirsk is shut for a week for maintenance .
signs are in place showing the diversion .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: listen : limited bus service returns to naburn village near york
text: villagers in naburn will be able to use a limited free bus service from today .
they 've been without a service since coach company utopia went bust .
it comes as the city of york council also starts a limited service through the village , covering the morning and evening rush hours .
john bibby is from york bus forum .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: travel : update on train services due to over-running engineering works
text: engineering works have been over-running between doncaster and sheffield and these were due to finish a few moments ago .
replacement bus services running on transpennine express between doncaster and sheffield .
tickets were being accepted on east midlands train services .
northern and cross country services have been suspended between doncaster and sheffield .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: travel : all lanes reopened at hartshead moor
text: queueing traffic due to earlier accident on m62 eastbound at hartshead moor services , congestion on m62 to j23 a640 / a643 ( huddersfield ) .
all lanes have been re-opened .

BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: listen : decision due on future of york 's council-run allotments
text: the future of hundreds of york allotment plots will be debated at a city council meeting later .
there 's more than 1,000 plots and the management of them could be transferred into a charity led by five expert gardeners .
green party councillor denise craghill says they must remain open and affordable to all .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: listen : murder investigation in sheffield
text: police have begun a murder investigation after a man died in sheffield .
officers were called to the wensley estate in firth park in the early hours of sunday morning .
i 've been to the scene .
author: Jenny Eells
MyBradford Producer, BBC Radio Leeds

the disruption is expected to last until 08:15 .

documents.title: good morning : welcome to our news coverage for monday
text: hello .
where did that weekend go ?
welcome to bbc local live coverage for yorkshire .
we 'll be here throughout the day to keep you up to date with the latest news , sport and weather .
it 's not a great start to this morning with rain in some parts of the region .
so here 's a beautiful atmospheric of scarborough castle from bbc weather watcher vonibor .
